verses.roman:
ānandita hailā śivāi pāda-prahāra pāñā
śīghra vāsā-ghara kailā gauḍa-ghare giyā

synonyms: ānandita hailā—became very pleased; śivāi—Śivānanda Sena; pāda-prahāra pāñā—being kicked; śīghra—very soon; vāsā-ghara—residential place; kailā—arranged; gauḍa-ghare—to a milkman's house; giyā—going.
translation: Very pleased at being kicked, Śivānanda Sena quickly arranged for a milkman's house to be the Lord's residence.
